General Provisions</h2><p class="mb-xs">1.1 This Privacy Policy uses the same terminology and abbreviations as defined in our Terms and Conditions document. This Policy governs the collection, use, storage and protection of information on Users collected through the use of the Platform.</p><p class="mb-xs">1.2 The information on Users is divided into personally identifiable and non-personally identifiable information depending on whether information can identify the User as a specific person.</p><p class="mb-xs">1.3 MetaApi DMCC, Unit No: 3O-01-BA1519, Jewellery &amp; Gemplex 3, Dubai, United Arab Emirates is responsible for compliance with the principles relating to processing of personal information. You can contact us by sending an email to support@metaapi.cloud.</p><h2 class="my-sm">2. Collection and Use of Personally Identifiable Information</h2><div class="mb-xs">2.1 We may obtain some of your personal information in order to provide our Services. The information we collect is necessary to provide our Services, and we shall not collect any information which is not required by the nature of our Services or which is beyond the purpose of use or collection of the information as described in this Policy. We may collect some of the following personal Information:<ul><li>KYC and KYB related information, such as User’s full name, date of birth, nationality, or residency information, location, business information</li><li>E-mail address</li><li>Phone number</li><li>IP address</li><li>Payment information and transaction history</li></ul></div><h3 class="my-sm">(A) KYC and KYB Information</h3><p class="mb-xs">2.2 In order to register to use our Platform, and access our Services, all Users need to confirm their identity, location and ability to act on behalf of business on our Platform. We conduct KYC and KYB checks to verify your user identity. KYC and KYB checks are part of our obligation to prevent anti-money laundering, fraudulent activities and/or prohibit use of our Services by entities subject to sanctions or embargoes.</p><p class="mb-xs">As part of KYC and KYB checks, you have to provide your full name (first and last name, middle name), date of birth, information about your citizenship and/or residency, information about your physical address for us to verify you. This information and documents are obligatory. In certain rare circumstances we may request, and you must timely provide us with official government-issued identification or other proof of identity, such as passport, ID, driver license, and proof of address, such as bank statement, or utility bill. If needed, you agree to provide us with any other additional documents and information for enhanced due diligence in accordance with applicable laws.</p><p class="mb-xs">If you act on behalf of a business or legal entity, you have to provide a company registration document, certificate of good standing, information about business activities, website, in addition to the personal information of your business’s directors and beneficial owner(s). This information is obligatory. In certain rare circumstances we may request, and you must timely provide us with any other necessary documents and information to identify your business or legal entity.</p><p class="mb-xs">We will only use this information to create an account for you and to address you whenever we contact you. The legal basis for processing of this information is contractual obligation.</p><p class="mb-xs">You authorize and allow MetaApi to process KYC and KYB of you and your business directly or through third parties. We may require you to provide us with necessary documents in the form of duly certified copies, copies or through face liveness check. If you do not provide such documents and information for verification during the registration or any time after (if requested) you will not be able to register an account with us or access our Services. You agree not to provide any false or misleading information about your identity or location, your business, directors and beneficial owner(s) of your business, or the activities your business perform, and you agree to correct any information that is or becomes false or misleading. We reserve the right to suspend or terminate your account, or access to our Services, of anyone who provides false, inaccurate, or incomplete information.</p><p class="mb-xs">We will keep KYC and KYB related information as long as you use our Platform or as required in accordance with the applicable law. We will store such information in a secure and specialized database.</p><h3 class="my-sm">(B) Email address</h3><p class="mb-xs">2.3 We will collect your email address on the basis of your consent or for delivering our Services depending on the situation. We will collect your email address in the following cases:</p><p class="mb-xs"><b>- When you register an account with us.</b> We will collect your email address to create and facilitate an account for you and to send you notifications about your account such as when you forget your password, we change our privacy policy, or if there is a data breach. Account is necessary to access some of our Services and if you do not provide us with your email address for this purpose you will not be able to access these Services.</p><p class="mb-xs"><b>- When you subscribe to receive notifications.</b> We will collect your email address when you subscribe to receive notifications from us. We will only use your email address to send you information about the upcoming promotions or other matters relating to the MetaApi Services. There will be a consent box during your registration by which you can provide your consent to have us collect, store, and process your email address in accordance with this Privacy Policy. You may unsubscribe from notifications at any time except for strictly necessary information.</p><p class="mb-xs"><b>- When you contact us.</b> We will collect your email address whenever you contact us through our email. Whenever we collect your email address this way, we will only use it in order to respond to your inquiry.</p><h3 class="my-sm">(C) Phone Number</h3><p class="mb-xs">2.4 We may collect your mobile phone number as part of your billing information and verification procedure. During the sign-up process, you are required to verify your mobile phone number through SMS verification. We process this information under the contractual legal basis for the purposes of processing payment information and verification.</p><h3 class="my-sm">(D) IP Address</h3><p class="mb-xs">2.5 We integrate security systems on our Platform to prevent malicious attempts and illegal exploits of the Platform. We monitor IP addresses, activity logs and ban IP addresses that show malicious signs such as too many password failures, seeking exploits, accessing the Platform from a banned location and similar. We process and keep IP addresses and activity logs  in the interest of protecting the integrity of the Platform and of the databases connected with it, including databases of information collected from Users. We use your IP address and activity logs on the basis of a legitimate interest.</p><h3 class="my-sm">(E) Payment information and transaction history</h3><p class="mb-xs">2.6 All payments on the Platform are conducted through third party service providers: Stripe Inc. You hereby accept that by making a purchase through our Platform, your personal information is being processed and handled in accordance with Stripe’s privacy policy available here<a href="https://stripe.com/en-gb-us/privacy"> https://stripe.com/en-gb-us/privacy</a> (as updated from time to time).</p><h3 class="my-sm">(F) General</h3><p class="mb-xs">2.7 Some Services will not be available to you if you do not provide requested information. We may keep records of any questions, complaints or compliments made by you and the response if any. Whenever you contact us, we shall collect any information which you choose to provide. We shall store and use this information only for the purpose of responding to your inquiries. Information contained within the inquiry, free from any personally identifiable information, will be stored on our servers for the purpose of improving our Services and providing the best customer support possible.</p><p class="mb-xs">2.8 We do not sell or rent personal information to any Third-Party. We use collected information for our internal and marketing purposes, as necessary by the nature of the Services, and only in accordance with this Privacy Policy. In some instances, we are obliged to comply with court orders and government requests and provide information or parts of it to authorized bodies. Some personal information is transferred to service providers in accordance with section G of this Privacy Policy.</p><p class="mb-xs">2.9 We have implemented security procedures and measures, including 2FA, in order to ensure appropriate protection of the information we process, against any misuse, unauthorized access, disclosure or modification.</p><p class="mb-xs">2.10 We acknowledge that the safety of your Information is one of the highest priorities and therefore only authorized processors have access to your information. Although we take all appropriate measures in respect to keeping your information secure, you understand that no data security measures in the world can offer 100% protection.</p><p class="mb-xs">2.11 Users may request access to and modification of personal information and the exercise of the right to object. Such requests are submitted to support@metaapi.cloud</p><h2 class="my-sm">3. Children privacy</h2><p class="mb-xs">3.1 The Services are intended for a general audience and are not targeted at children. We take children’s online safety very seriously, and if we ever learn that the Information collected belongs to a child, we will immediately remove any such information. If you are younger than 18 you are not allowed to register or use the Platform.</p><h2 class="my-sm">4. Collection and Use of Non-Personally Identifiable Information</h2><p class="mb-xs">4.1 The Site collects a series of general data and information when a User or automated system calls up the Platform. This general data and information are stored in the server log files. Collected information may be (1) the browser types and versions used, (2) the operating system used by the accessing system, (3) the website from which an accessing system reaches our website (so-called referrers), (4) the sub-websites, (5) the date and time of access to the internet site, (6) the internet service provider of the accessing system, (7) IP address, and (8) any other similar data and information that may be used in the event of attacks on our information technology systems.</p><p class="mb-xs">4.2 We collect this information for breach investigation purposes. When using this information, we do not use it to personally identify any User. Rather, this information is needed to (1) deliver the content of our Platform correctly, (2) optimize the content of our Platform as well as its advertisement, (3) ensure the long-term viability of our information technology systems and website technology, and (4) provide law enforcement authorities with the information necessary for criminal prosecution in case of a cyber-attack or illegal activities. For avoidance of doubt, when we conduct an investigation, we may use any publicly available information about a User. The anonymous data of the server log files are stored separately from all personal data provided by a User.</p><div class="mb-xs">4.3 Additionally, for correct operation of our application we collect following information:<ul><li>trading account information</li><li>open positions data</li><li>open orders data</li><li>trading account order and deal history.</li></ul></div><h2 class="my-sm">5. Storage and transfer of information</h2><p class="mb-xs">5.1 Information will be stored on secure servers which are located in the UK and US. Hosted servers are controlled and maintained in accordance with sufficient privacy safeguards. We may store or transfer information on Users to processors located outside of the UK and US, provided that such processors implement appropriate and suitable safeguards regarding the security of personal information.</p><p class="mb-xs">5.2 If you register an account with us we will store your Information for as long as you have an active account. We may keep your information for up to a year (unless otherwise required in accordance with applicable law) after your deactivation of the user account in our backup in order to maintain the integrity of our backup storage data as well as in order to address any appeals or requests pursuant to your purchases.</p><h2 class="my-sm">6. User’s Rights</h2><div class="mb-xs">6.1 User may request to:<ul><li>Obtain confirmation if your Information is processed, access Information about you that we had stored as well as supplementary information.</li><li>Receive a copy of Information on you that is held by MetaApi in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format.</li><li>Correct your Information.</li><li>Have your Personal Information deleted.</li><li>Object to the processing of Information by MetaApi.</li><li>Restrict the processing of your Information by MetaApi.</li><li>File a complaint with a supervisory authority.</li></ul></div><p class="mb-xs">6.2 These rights might be limited if they are subject to MetaApi’s own legitimate interests and regulatory requirements.</p><h2 class="my-sm">7. Cookies and similar technologies</h2><p class="mb-xs">7.1 Cookies help us optimize and improve the user experience of the Site by helping us deliver crucial functionalities. The cookies we use may vary over time as we continuously update and improve our Site.</p><p class="mb-xs">7.2 By visiting the Site we may use cookies to store some non-identifiable Information in your browser regarding your computer or mobile device and your activities in order to help improve the user experience. Users can deny access to cookies through their browser settings.</p><h2 class="my-sm">8. Third Party Websites, Services, and Cookies</h2><p class="mb-xs">8.1 The Platform or e-mails may contain links to other external websites that do not fall under our domain. We are not responsible for the privacy practices or the content of such external websites. If you choose to follow such links to external websites, you do so at your risk.</p><p class="mb-xs">8.2 You can manage your cookies preferences at any time. This is done in your browser or device settings. Depending on which browser and device you use you may be able to control which cookies you allow, which cookies you want to block in the future, and delete cookies. For more information about these settings visit your browser or device´s help page. Note that some of MetaApi’s Services might not work as intended if you choose to disable cookies.</p><p class="mb-xs">8.3 Third-party vendors, including Google, use cookies to collect anonymous statistical data. Any data collected will be used in accordance with our Privacy Policy and Google’s privacy policy. Users may opt out of Google’s use of Google Analytics by visiting the Google Analytics Opt-out Page. Users may opt out of third-party vendor use of cookies by visiting<a href="https://optout.networkadvertising.org"> the Network Advertising Initiative Opt-out Page</a>.</p><h2 class="my-sm">9. Notifications</h2><p class="mb-xs">9.1 We may occasionally use your email to send you personalized notifications regarding new or existing services offered by MetaApi that we may consider as of interest for you. The details of such notifications are only personal to you, and shall be considered as confidential for both parties. You may unsubscribe from such notification at any time.</p><p class="mb-xs">9.2 We may also send you strictly necessary and administrative announcements from time to time by email. You may not unsubscribe from such notifications as they are important announcements related to your use of the Services.</p><p class="mb-xs">9.3 By providing any personal information to us, or by using our Site in any manner, you have created a commercial relationship with us. As such, you agree that any notification sent from us, even unsolicited e-mail, as that term is legally defined.</p><h2 class="my-sm">10. Changes to the Privacy Policy</h2><p class="mb-xs">10.1 We reserve the right to change our Privacy Policy at any time. The current version of Privacy Policy is available on the Site, indicating the effective date. You are encouraged to periodically check our Privacy Policy.</p><h2 class="my-sm">11. Contact Information</h2><p class="mb-xs">11.1 If you have any queries or concerns regarding our Privacy Policy and how the information is handled, or you wish to access, retrieve, amend, or update your Information feel free to contact us at support@metaapi.cloud.</p></div></div><script id="__NEXT_DATA__" type="application/json">{"props":{"pageProps":{}},"page":"/privacy_uae","query":{},"buildId":"7EPTqa5-irMoBNGGicz3b","nextExport":true,"autoExport":true,"isFallback":false,"scriptLoader":[]}</script></body></html>
